title: Glastonbury Festival 2020 confirms Diana Ross for legends slot
text:
The global superstar has confirmed the news (Picture: Backgrid)

Diana Ross has revealed she will be performing at Glastonbury Festival next year.

The iconic singer took to Twitter to share the news and we couldn’t be more excited.

She tweeted: ‘This is a dream come true. To all the fans across the world, this is my tribute to you. I’m coming to Glastonbury, with love. #Gladyonbury2020 @GlastoFest [sic].’

The 75-year-old may have called it Gladyonbury but that doesn’t change the fact she will be blessing our ears with club favourite I’m Coming Out at the Pyramid Stage.

Glastonbury themselves also confirmed the news on their Twitter account.

‘We are delighted to announce that @DianaRoss will play the Sunday legends slot on the Pyramid Stage at Glastonbury 2020,’ they tweeted.

We are delighted to announce that @DianaRoss will play the Sunday legends slot on the Pyramid Stage at Glastonbury 2020. pic.twitter.com/fm4iewfWqN — Glastonbury Festival (@GlastoFest) October 10, 2019

Fans couldn’t help but share the excitement after hearing the news.

One use tweeted: ‘You’re going to kill it my queen!!!! I’m so happy for you’ along with three love hearts.

‘Brilliant news I thought it was going to be her. Totally deserves the legend slot,’ another tweeted.

Emily Eavis, Glastonbury co-organiser, said: ‘I am delighted to say that one of the all-time greats, the wonderful Diana Ross, is coming to Glastonbury to play the Sunday legend slot on the Pyramid next year.’

2020 can’t come fast enough.
